page.title: 11HOUSING DEVELOPMENT: L'BORO
page.content:
In the 1930's ribbon development along Nanpantan Road was evident and only a few houses were older than this,many of them being farmhouses*.Then in the 1960's,1970's & 1980's there was an infill when much of the land once owned by farmers was developed by builders.There is a new estate in our D-block which was started in 1982, houses are still being built there in 1985.Most of these have double garages and all of them are detached.The majority of houses in our D-block would cost over Â£40,000. The single greatest employer of people is the teaching profession with the university coming a close second, followed by people employed by Hawker Siddley.
* dating from about 1750 which was when land enclosure came to our area.
